title: How to Milk a Cow By Hands | Evening Milking Of Cow By Hand

subtasks: Sit on the tractor seat.
Adjust the seat for comfort.
Start the tractor engine.
Check all instruments and controls.
Press the clutch pedal to shift gears.
Use the steering wheel to turn the tractor.
Apply the brakes to stop the tractor.
Engage the differential lock when needed.
Operate the hydraulic system for lift attachments.
Adjust the implements to match the ground.
Monitor the field's progress while driving.
Load the combine harvester with the harvested grain.
Secure the harvester onto the tractor.
Engage the lift to raise the harvester.
Control the combine harvester while moving.
Use the header to cut plants at the desired height.
Adjust the cutter bar height.
Operate the threshing system to separate grain from chaff.
Regulate the concave and筛面 speed.
Adjust the antique finger gear if needed.
Clean the grain from the screen.
Attach the manure spreader to the tractor.
Check the spreader’s settings for coverage.
Engage the manure spreader.
Operate the hydraulic system to open/close the gates.
Drive the tractor with spreader across the field.
Ensure even distribution of manure across the soil.
Adjust speed to control spreader output.
Fill the sprayer tank with pesticide.
Set the correct pesticide ratio.
Connect the sprayer hoses to the tractor’s pump.
Adjust the pressure gauge to the appropriate setting.
Calibrate the nozzles for optimal spray coverage.
Start the sprayer pump and monitor pressure.
Operate the spray boom and adjust height.
Spot-spray areas as needed.
Discharge any leftover spray at the end of the day.
Assemble the seed drill components.
Load the seed drill with seeds.
Adjust the depth gauge wheels for proper seeding depth.
Set the hitch to the correct position.
Drive the seed drill over the field ensuring proper seeding rate.
Monitor the seed placement and soil cover.

tasks.task: Drive tractor with attachments through field.
subtasks: Assess the field conditions for varying speeds.
Choose the gear ratio for traction.
Adjust the steering as needed to navigate through rows.
Increase or decrease throttle as needed for the task.
Periodically check the rearview mirror when needed.

tasks.task: Conduct stand counts and check the field for weed growth.
subtasks: Walk through the fields to visually inspect crop growth.
Identify weak spots or uneven growth.
Check for signs of pests or diseases.
Take random samples for stand count.
Note down observations for future reference.

tasks.task: Start tractor and operation includes subtasks related to sitting, starting, checking, shifting, steering, etc. Then, for each machine: MAINTASK: Start harvesting, would have subtasks like setting up the combine, controlling it, adjusting header, cleaning, etc. Similarly, applying manure: attaching, operating, adjusting spreader. Operating sprayer: filling, setting ratios, connecting, operating spray boom. Seed drilling: setting up the drill, driving while seeding, monitoring. Then, conducting field inspections: walking through, inspecting plants, checking for weeds, taking notes.

Therefore, considering all that, the answer includes multiple MAINTASKs for each major operation (tractor, combine, spreader, sprayer, seed drill) along with their respective subtasks. Field inspections are also a separate MAINTASK with its own subtasks.
